DataElement.preferredName: Other Organ Impairment And/Or Disease or Disorder Occurrence Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another organ impairment and/or disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Other Organ Impairment And/Or Disease or Disorder Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Other Organ Impairment And/Or Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Loss or abnormality of psychological, physiological, or anatomic structure or function.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
